other_tests.findings: Extremely high plasma 17β-estradiol levels (9476 pmol/L), elevated gonadotrophin levels (LH: 24 IU/L, FSH: 13 IU/L) strongly suggestive of estrogen resistance.
Homozygous missense mutation (R394H) in the ESR1 gene found in all affected individuals.
Enlarged multicystic ovaries noted in the two affected sisters.
Delayed bone maturation noted for the proband (13 years at 19 years old), affected sister (13 years at 21 years old), and affected brother (11 years at 18 years old).
Both wild-type and mutant ERα expressed at similar protein levels in HEK293T cells.
Transactivation sensitivity of the R394H ERα mutant was greatly reduced compared to the wild-type ERα levels.
